title: Crafting the digital self: Expert personal branding on social media in the age of AI
hypotheses: Expert professionals can leverage social media to build effective personal brands, and AI can accelerate content creation for personal branding
notes: Qualitative research using semi-structured thematic interviews examining how experts build personal brands on social media and utilize AI
strengths: Comprehensive theoretical framework combining personal brand building, brand equity, and AI utilization; Contemporary relevance to AI era
weaknesses: Limited to qualitative methodology; Sample size and generalizability not specified
methodology: Qualitative research with semi-structured thematic interviews
key_findings: Personal branding has become increasingly important due to job market changes and technological advancement; AI accelerates content creation
citation: Huhta-Koivisto, T. (2025). Crafting the digital self: Expert personal branding on social media in the age of AI. Master's thesis, Aalto University.

title: Personal Branding in the Digital Era: Social Media Strategies for Graduates
hypotheses: Digital era social media strategies can effectively enhance personal branding for graduates entering the job market
notes: Focuses on graduate-level personal branding strategies using social media platforms
strengths: Addresses specific demographic (graduates); Practical social media strategy focus
weaknesses: Limited scope to graduates; May not apply to established professionals
key_findings: Social media strategies are crucial for graduate-level personal branding in the digital era
citation: Kanasan, M., & Rahman, T. A. (2024). Personal Branding in the Digital Era: Social Media Strategies for Graduates. Journal of Communication, 5(1), 40-59.

title: Leveraging AI for Enhanced Personal Branding on LinkedIn: Implications of User Engagement and Trust
subject: Business and Economics
keywords: AI Exposure, Attitudes towards AI, Perception of AI Accuracy, Brand Trust, Technology Acceptance Model, AI-Powered Profile Building, LinkedIn
hypotheses: AI exposure and positive attitudes toward AI accuracy influence adoption of AI-powered profile building on LinkedIn
notes: Applies Technology Acceptance Model to LinkedIn AI-powered personal branding tools
strengths: Strong theoretical foundation (TAM); Platform-specific focus on LinkedIn; Addresses trust and engagement factors
weaknesses: Limited to LinkedIn platform; Cross-sectional design
key_findings: AI exposure and attitudes toward AI accuracy significantly influence user engagement and trust in AI-powered personal branding
citation: Budi, I. D., & Alinaghian, E. (2024). Leveraging AI for Enhanced Personal Branding on LinkedIn: Implications of User Engagement and Trust. Master's thesis, Lund University.

title: AI-driven personalization: Unraveling consumer perceptions in social media engagement
hypotheses: AI-enabled personalization boosts consumer trust and usefulness perceptions; Privacy concerns challenge AI-driven personalization effectiveness
notes: Examines consumer perceptions of AI-driven personalization in social media contexts
strengths: Addresses both positive and negative aspects of AI personalization; Consumer perception focus
weaknesses: Abstract access only; Limited methodology details available
key_findings: AI personalization enhances trust and usefulness perceptions but faces privacy-related challenges
citation: Aguirre, E. (2025). AI-driven personalization: Unraveling consumer perceptions in social media engagement. Computers in Human Behavior, 165, 108549.

title: The effect of artificial intelligence generated content and user generated content on social media marketing strategy
authors: Shamenda Shantatula, Zhange Lei, John Wiredu
hypotheses: AI-generated content and user-generated content have distinct effects on social media marketing strategy effectiveness
notes: Comparative analysis of AI-generated vs user-generated content in social media marketing contexts
strengths: Direct comparison of AI vs user content; Marketing strategy focus
weaknesses: Limited scope (4 pages); Journal impact factor unclear
key_findings: Both AI-generated and user-generated content have advantages and disadvantages; potential synergies exist between content types
citation: Shantatula, S., Lei, Z., & Wiredu, J. (2024). The effect of artificial intelligence generated content and user generated content on social media marketing strategy. International Journal of Development Research, 14, 27919.

title: The Role of Artificial Intelligence in Personalizing Social Media Marketing Strategies for Enhanced Customer Experience
hypotheses: AI personalization enhances customer experience in social media marketing through improved targeting and content customization
notes: Focus on customer experience enhancement through AI-driven personalization strategies
strengths: Customer experience focus; AI personalization emphasis; Open access publication
weaknesses: General marketing focus rather than personal branding specific
key_findings: AI significantly enhances personalization capabilities in social media marketing, leading to improved customer experiences
citation: Beyari, H., & Hashem, T. (2025). The Role of Artificial Intelligence in Personalizing Social Media Marketing Strategies for Enhanced Customer Experience. Behavioral Sciences, 15(5), 700.

title: Effectiveness of Social Media Marketing Strategies for Beauty Accounts on Instagram
hypotheses: Specific social media marketing strategies demonstrate measurable effectiveness for beauty accounts on Instagram
notes: Industry-specific analysis of social media marketing effectiveness with quantifiable metrics
strengths: Industry-specific focus; Empirical effectiveness measurement; Instagram platform specificity
weaknesses: Limited to beauty industry; Single platform focus; Pre-AI era research
methodology: Quantitative analysis of Instagram engagement metrics
key_findings: Certain marketing strategies show measurable effectiveness improvements for beauty brands on Instagram
citation: Reis, G. (2021). Effectiveness of Social Media Marketing Strategies for Beauty Accounts on Instagram. Master's thesis, University of the Pacific.

title: The impact of influencers on brand social network growth
authors: I. Antoniadis, S. Paltsoglou, V. Patoulidis
hypotheses: Influencer characteristics and behaviors drive follower migration to sponsored brand social networks; Central social hub positions enhance influence effectiveness
notes: Large-scale empirical study using over two million tweets analyzing influencer impact on brand network growth
strengths: Large dataset (2M+ tweets); Network theory foundation; Empirical methodology; Gaming industry focus
weaknesses: Limited to gaming industry; Twitter platform specific
methodology: Quantitative analysis of Twitter data using Social Network Theory
key_findings: Frequent influencer-follower interactions enhance brand awareness; Central hub positioning and high popularity drive brand growth
citation: Antoniadis, I., Paltsoglou, S., & Patoulidis, V. (2025). The impact of influencers on brand social network growth. Journal of Business Research, 114716.

title: Battle of Influence: Analysing the Impact of Brand-Directed and Influencer-Directed Social Media Marketing on Customer Engagement and Purchase Behaviour
hypotheses: Brand-directed and influencer-directed social media marketing have differential impacts on customer engagement and purchase behavior
notes: Comparative study analyzing different social media marketing approaches and their effectiveness
strengths: Comparative methodology; Purchase behavior measurement; High-impact journal
weaknesses: Abstract access only; Limited methodology details
methodology: Survey research design and field experiment
key_findings: Different social media communication tactics have varying impacts on customer engagement and purchase behavior
citation: Yiu, C. S. (2025). Battle of Influence: Analysing the Impact of Brand-Directed and Influencer-Directed Social Media Marketing on Customer Engagement and Purchase Behaviour. Australasian Marketing Journal.

title: Analyzing the Influence of Social Media Influencer's Attributes and Content Esthetics on Endorsed Brand Attitude and Brand-Link Click Behavior: The Mediating Role of Brand Content Engagement
hypotheses: Influencer attributes and content aesthetics influence brand attitude through brand content engagement mediation
notes: Examines the mediation role of content engagement in influencer marketing effectiveness
strengths: Mediation analysis; Content aesthetics focus; Brand behavior measurement
weaknesses: Limited to influencer context rather than personal branding
key_findings: Content engagement mediates the relationship between influencer attributes/aesthetics and brand outcomes
citation: Mir, I. A., & Salo, J. (2024). Analyzing the Influence of Social Media Influencer's Attributes and Content Esthetics on Endorsed Brand Attitude and Brand-Link Click Behavior. Journal of Promotion Management, 30(1), 1-28.

title: Unlocking Social Media Success: How Prosumers Drive Brand Engagement through Authentic Conversations with Consumers
hypotheses: Prosumer-generated content fosters higher consumer engagement than firm-generated content through authenticity and relevance
notes: Four between-subjects experiments (N=1048) plus qualitative study with brand managers analyzing prosumer-led engagement
strengths: Mixed-methods approach; Large sample size; Practical management insights; Multiple experiments
weaknesses: Limited to prosumer context; May not directly apply to individual personal branding
methodology: Mixed-methods: Four experiments plus qualitative interviews
key_findings: Prosumer-led conversations generate higher engagement through perceived authenticity; Content type and authenticity are fundamental selection criteria
citation: Malodia, S. (2024). Unlocking Social Media Success: How Prosumers Drive Brand Engagement through Authentic Conversations with Consumers. British Journal of Management.

title: Social media marketing content strategy: A comprehensive examination of content characteristics and user engagement
hypotheses: Specific content characteristics (multimedia, transformational appeal, interactivity, timing) significantly influence user engagement levels
notes: Analysis of 18 brand Facebook pages across nine industries to identify engagement-driving content characteristics
strengths: Multi-industry analysis; Comprehensive content characteristic examination; Platform-specific insights
weaknesses: Limited to Facebook; Industry-focused rather than personal branding
methodology: Content analysis of Facebook pages with engagement metrics
key_findings: Multimedia content, transformational appeal, low interactivity, and weekday posting drive higher engagement; longer posts generate more sharing
citation: Drossos, D. (2024). Social media marketing content strategy: A comprehensive examination of content characteristics and user engagement. Journal of Consumer Behaviour.

title: Bridging the gap between B2B and B2C: Thought leadership in industrial marketing – A systematic literature review and propositions
authors: Tina Neuhaus, Jan Andre Millemann, Ed Nijssen
hypotheses: Thought leadership strategies from B2C influencer marketing can be effectively transferred to B2B industrial marketing contexts
notes: Systematic literature review bridging B2C influencer research with B2B thought leadership applications
strengths: Systematic literature review methodology; B2B focus; Cross-domain knowledge transfer
weaknesses: Pre-AI era research; Limited to industrial marketing context
key_findings: Social networks' importance in marketing mix has increased significantly; thought leadership research is gaining traction in B2B contexts
citation: Neuhaus, T., Millemann, J. A., & Nijssen, E. (2022). Bridging the gap between B2B and B2C: Thought leadership in industrial marketing – A systematic literature review and propositions. Industrial Marketing Management, 106, 99-111.

title: New Study Shows How AI Has Taken Over LinkedIn Thought Leadership
hypotheses: AI-generated content has significantly infiltrated professional thought leadership on LinkedIn, potentially diminishing authenticity
notes: Industry analysis of Originality.AI study revealing extent of AI-assisted content in LinkedIn thought leadership
strengths: Large sample analysis; Current and relevant; Authenticity focus
weaknesses: Industry publication rather than peer-reviewed; Limited analytical depth
methodology: AI detection analysis of LinkedIn posts
key_findings: 54% of long-form LinkedIn posts are AI-generated or AI-assisted; authenticity concerns in professional thought leadership
citation: Thibodeaux, W. (2025). New Study Shows How AI Has Taken Over LinkedIn Thought Leadership. LinkedIn Analysis.

title: A realistic role for AI in thought leadership
hypotheses: AI can support thought leadership through process improvement while human insight remains essential for authentic leadership
notes: Professional perspective on balancing AI efficiency with authentic thought leadership requirements
strengths: Practical perspective; Balance of AI benefits and limitations; Authenticity focus
weaknesses: Non-academic source; Limited research backing
key_findings: AI can grab attention through facile content but substance and consistency are required for genuine thought leadership
citation: Frearson, M. (2025). A realistic role for AI in thought leadership. Medium.

title: Harnessing AI Content Creation for Thought Leadership Success
hypotheses: AI can significantly enhance thought leadership content creation when used as augmentation rather than replacement
notes: Practical guidance on leveraging AI for thought leadership content while maintaining authenticity and avoiding biases
strengths: Practical implementation focus; Ethical considerations; Bias awareness
weaknesses: Commercial source; Limited research validation
key_findings: AI offers significant time savings and creativity enhancement but requires human oversight for ethics, originality, and bias prevention
citation: The Writers For Hire. (2024). Harnessing AI Content Creation for Thought Leadership Success.

title: Thought leadership vs. AI content: Why authenticity wins every time
hypotheses: Human insights and authentic perspectives maintain superior value over AI-generated content in thought leadership contexts
notes: Analysis of why authentic human perspectives continue to outperform AI content in professional contexts
strengths: Industry expertise; Authenticity focus; Practical insights
weaknesses: Commercial perspective; Limited academic rigor
key_findings: AI-driven content hyperinflation increases the need for unique, high-quality human-created content; authenticity becomes a key differentiator
citation: Amitay, T. (2024). Thought leadership vs. AI content: Why authenticity wins every time. Entail AI.

title: Thought Leadership in the AI Age Belongs to Those Who Connect, Not Control
hypotheses: AI democratizes access to information, making connection and perspective more valuable than information control in thought leadership
notes: Strategic analysis of how AI changes the requirements and approaches for effective thought leadership
strengths: Strategic perspective; Future-focused; Community-building emphasis
weaknesses: Industry publication; Limited research validation
key_findings: When AI gives everyone access to the same information, perspective and persuasion become more important; community connection trumps information control
citation: Rose, R. (2025). Thought Leadership in the AI Age Belongs to Those Who Connect, Not Control. Content Marketing Institute.

title: How to Harness Social Media for Personal Branding
hypotheses: Strategic social media use can effectively build and enhance personal brands for business professionals
notes: Harvard Business School guidance on personal branding strategies using social media platforms
strengths: Institutional authority (Harvard); Professional focus; Strategic approach
weaknesses: Educational content rather than research; Limited AI integration discussion
key_findings: Social media provides powerful opportunities for personal branding when approached strategically with authentic professional content
citation: Stobierski, T. (2025). How to Harness Social Media for Personal Branding. Harvard Business School Online.

title: Social Media Marketing Effectiveness: Statistics & Research Papers
hypotheses: Social media marketing effectiveness can be measured and optimized through specific strategies and metrics
notes: Comprehensive compilation of social media marketing effectiveness research and statistics
strengths: Research compilation; Statistical focus; Multiple source integration
weaknesses: Commercial perspective; Secondary source aggregation
key_findings: 5.22 billion active users globally; targeted campaigns and personalized content show significantly higher returns; customer engagement correlates with brand loyalty
citation: Targosz, M. (2025). Social Media Marketing Effectiveness: Statistics & Research Papers. Landingi.
